Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @SHossain @jl777c I have stopped USDKTEST chain to bring up new chain on pegs with new gateway. We said the new chain should have aPoW, is there anything else we mentioned that we need to add to these chains?

Content: lets make it a EUR peg

Content: Yes, I'm doing that - EURK

Content: other than -adaptivepow, i dont think any other changes from last time around

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @jl777c The plan for txfees is to set to all cc transactions that we use in pegs and side chains (oracles, gateways, tokens, pegs ...) txfee to 0. And then I will add to miner code priority with flat multiplier. The question is should I give that high priority only to CC txs or to all txs on that chain? (I think only to those CC txs)

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Hmmm, weird thing. I started the chain with same ac parameters on 2 nodes and got different magic number and port...

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Ahhh, never mind. Error in copy paste

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: high priority only for the special tx, other tx should just default to normal mechanism

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Ok, I thought so. And another thing is we should branch the txfee somehow. If I put in code 0 txfee then on all chains for Oracles fro example it will be 0 txfee. Maybe we can add it as parameter on launch, and for certain CCs check if parameter is set and set txfee to that value, if not then default 10k txfee.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I think it could be bacuse there are small chain forks as both nodes are mining with cpu with one thread and some times there are chain splits but when longer chain happens it one node switches to main chain, and maybe then this happens...

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Not sure.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no idea. seems some malformed tx

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I'm thinking about oracles tx from oraclefeed for block data

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: mempool transaction missing input" == 0

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: What would happen if one node goes in other direction and when it switches to main chain, the transaction in mempool could be refering input that does not exist anymore.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: But those txs should be removed from mempool

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Also not sure why this: `ERROR: ContextualCheckBlock: block height mismatch in coinbase`

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there does seem to be a bug where invalid tx are not purged from mempool

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it can be reproduced, you need to work backwards from the error

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Yes, the problem is that it happens sometimes. Not sure how to reproduce it...

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: But looking now, it seems my chain splitted on block 26

Author: Mihailo#5902
Mihailo#5902
jl777c#5810
Content: not a good idea to be mining on more than one node during the early blocks

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Aha, didn't know that. What is the reason? Whate changes after more blocks?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: before 100 blocks things are just very prone to forking

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: probably due to the total chain work being so small, it can easily flip flop between two very different forks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i just always mine on a single node until it is in the 1000+ height to avoid such problems

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Aha, good. As I noticed that it forks often. Now I know üòâ
